page.title: 08LAW AND ORDER
page.content: There is no longer any police station in our area, but a community policeman is attached to Mannamead and parts of Peverell and he is in communication with Crownhill Police Station. The Mutley area has no such cover, but if summoned, panda patrols will be sent from Charles Church police station in the city centre. There is only one traffic warden, who covers Mutley Plain and parts of Peverell. We also identified twenty three firms of solicitors, although we were not able to ascertain the exact number of solicitors employed in these firms. The area has a fire station at Greenbank. There are four fire engines and the firemen work in shifts of fifteen men.
